title: The Judicial Branch
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 496 words, Level N (Grade 2), Lexile 800L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     V and Z1
description: The U.S. Constitution founded three branches of government, including the judicial branch. This branch manages the country's legal process, interprets its laws, and protects the rights of its people. Federal judges review cases and ensure that justice is done. Along with two other branches of the United States government, the judicial branch helps establish a balance of power in the country.
highFrequencyWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
